sn22.97:4.2: Seated at one side that mendicant said to the Buddha:
sn22.97:4.3: “Sir, is there any form at all that’s permanent, everlasting, eternal, imperishable, and will last forever and ever?
sn22.97:4.7: consciousness at all that’s permanent, everlasting, eternal, imperishable, and will last forever and ever?”
sn22.97:4.8: “Mendicant, there is no form at all that’s permanent, everlasting, eternal, imperishable, and will last forever and ever.
sn22.97:4.12: consciousness at all that’s permanent, everlasting, eternal, imperishable, and will last forever and ever.”
sn22.97:5.1: Then the Buddha, picking up a little bit of dirt under his fingernail, addressed that mendicant:
sn22.97:5.2: “There’s not even this much of any form that’s permanent, everlasting, eternal, imperishable, and will last forever and ever.
sn22.97:5.3: If there was, this living of the spiritual life for the complete ending of suffering would not be found.
sn22.97:5.4: But since there isn’t, this living of the spiritual life for the complete ending of suffering is found.
sn22.97:6.1: There’s not even this much of any feeling …
sn22.97:8.1: consciousness that’s permanent, everlasting, eternal, imperishable, and will last forever and ever.
sn22.97:8.2: If there was, this living of the spiritual life for the complete ending of suffering would not be found.
sn22.97:8.3: But since there isn’t, this living of the spiritual life for the complete ending of suffering is found.
sn22.97:9.1: What do you think, mendicant? Is form permanent or impermanent?”
sn22.97:9.10: They understand: ‘… there is no return to any state of existence.’”
